attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The housing market in the uk has come to a vitual stand still over the last 12 months. 

First time buyers are having to put down on average 18% deposit, the largest deposit in over 30 years due to the banks reluctance to lend a high loan to property Value.

A lot of young people desire to own their own home shown by the recent increase in first time buyer enquiries at estate agents.

If either Bradford & Bingley or Northern Rock were to loan at 95% loan to value then this would bring stability to the housing market, this in turn would allow house builders and all associated trades to continue in business.

I urge Gordon Brown to make these two nationised bank to lead by example and become the specialist first time buyer mortgage provider.
